pros: A healthy work life balance is encouraged. The individuals that I work with and interact with are incredibly supportive. The staff is friendly and kind, and the environment is relaxed. The benefits are incredibly rich! (medical, dental, vision, fsa, hsa, dependent care, transportation, retirment,,tuition reimburse, some loan repayment etc.)
cons: The salaries are a little on the on the low side.

job_title: Senior Director Revenue Cycle Management in Philadelphia, PA
pros:
Before starting my carrier at Delaware Valley Community Health (DVCH) I was in retail management, and I burned out. I needed something to do so I got a job doing data entry for programs at DVCH. Eventually worked at the front desk and then moved into the Billing Department where I hit my stride. I was a Billing Clerk, Billing Team Leader, Billing Manager, Director of Billing and today Senior Director of Revenue Cycle Management, this took over 25 years. I was fortunate to find a leader that influenced me to strive to be better as an employee and an individual and as the organization grew, I got to grow with it. Also, I continue to learn, which is important to me. One of the most exciting parts of my job is using what I have learned over the years and applying to the continuing changing healthcare finance/billing world. Embracing technology has always been a passion of mine and at DVCH they welcome new ideas that can improve process.
One of the most impressive parts of my job is what I do helps support the DVCH mission, caring for their communities health, check it out www.dvch.org for a business to care so much about its patients and staff is unbelievable. DVCH is a healthcare business that puts people first.
cons: DVCH has had dramatic growth over the last few years, which is good and very exciting but some days you feel it.

pros: Honestly, I don’t really have many good things to say about this position at the Fairmount location. I would advise you not to even bother going in for an interview
cons: Very unprofessional and poorly ran. Do not feed into the hiring manager saying there’s room for growth because you’ll be working there for 10 years before you see a $2.00 raise.

review_title: I'm proud to work for Delaware Valley Community Health!
job_title: Certified Community Health Worker in Philadelphia, PA
pros: The CEO and the leaders truly care about the employees here and their wants and needs. During the Pandemic a great deal of work went into making sure employees had what they needed in terms of flexible work hours, working from home and still getting their full salary. I am very thankful!
cons: I cannot specify any cons based on my personal experiences.

job_title: Chief Medical Officer in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Engaged leadership, mission driven, opportunity for growth, valued employees, dedicated teams
cons: Serves a community with complex health care and social needs, can be stressful

review_title: It's an interesting place to work. Everyone is friendly.
pros: Management willing to work with schedules.  Salary isn't bad. The work can be very focus driven. My place of employment is convenient to public transportation.
cons: The sick policy is strange; you are not allowed to call out sick the same day-you must call out the evening before by 6:00 pm otherwise your sick day will go against you. If you get 3 or occurrences you will get written up.

job_title: Adult Nurse Practitioner in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Phenomenal sense of team, great medical director leadership, evidenced based practice oriented. FTO is excellent.

cons: Challenging population but not a bad thing.
